reviews.review_msg: He is by far one of my most favorite profs I had at SFU. He's one of those professors you recall a year or two after you've graduated and smile. Wonderful guy, genuinely wants to help you. Those who do poorly are the ones that dont attened his class because they find it boring.

He's a fun guy. One time we got to do our tutorial class outside in the grass. It's interesting for someone who is interested in the media and ways that people lived such as how important hockey is and inventions that were made, which amused me. He sings and plays guitar too. Overall, it was a fun class and the final was pretty easy for me.

This is the second class I've had with Seager, and I think he is much better suited to this seminar style over a lecture. You can tell he is really passionate and wants his students to get all that they can out of the class. I wish he had lectured a bit more (class was a bit heavy on peer presentations) but the field trips/arts & crafts were great!

I have had two courses with Seager and I agree with some of the posts about his in-class tangents, but I enjoy him and he is a really good person and is willing to help with any questions that arise.  Would recommend him.

Seager is by far one of the best profs I have encountered at SFU. He challenges students to think and treats those who do engage in class as equals. If you aren't into thinking critically about what you read, this isn't the class for you. Also be prepared for the occasional sing-along.

Very bad. take it only when you absolutely love history. History by i mean the most minor impact like the social impact of the comic Captain Canuck..or TVs. Deals very littel witht the real Canadian social issues such as racism, inequaliy, first nations and etc.

Has an interesting way of seeming a bit doddering but is EXTREMELY sharp. A bait and switch! Very aware of current culture, though clearly his passion is history. Very helpful when approached, very encouraging of discussion in tutorial. A little disorganized but is happy to give clarification when asked. Very enlightening class.

Professor Seager is really hard to understand in lecture. It is difficult to follow some of his tangents and the notes I took didn't seem to help for the exam. His anecdotes were interesting but often made it difficult to determine what to focus on from the course. Don't expect much, it's a Canadian history class.

Dr. Seager delivers a course rich in textual breadth, film, art gallery and museum visits, student presentations and a guest speaker - great connectors for the themes of BC history to current issues.  He is patient, considerate and encouraging;  attention to and note of his in-class comments are boosters for the final exam.   A gem of a course.
Allen is a excellent prof and is considerate to all of his students.

Half way through the semester and so far so good. I wish we'd stay the whole time, though. Sometimes I wonder if he's a communist, but it takes all kinds to stimulate discussion. He's very approachable and knowledgeable.

he made the course relevant to our current political experience. If your someone who can engage the text and make connections to the current reality you will love his teachings.  Allen has character and makes it fun, if you do your readings and think critically about the topics with maturity then your excel.

I can't comment much on his lecturing since he didn't do any in hist 436, but he was very kind and made students feel at ease when presenting. During the break he'd sometimes come back with cups of water or snacks to share with students. First few classes were boring without any presentations, but after that they were fine.

Kind of boring as a lecturer, but a good teacher overall. He encourages many questions and answers them well. Make sure you do the readings! Relatively easy marker. Tutorials are generally uneventful and its hard to get a conversation going.

I am nearing the end of this term and have 1 more class with him. I'm sad, I'll admit it. He is wonderful. It seems from the comments that if you are 1st yr he's not so good but upper div he's awesome. I look forward to every class. I'm a french major so it's my only english class. He's smart,funny,helpful,encouraging.One of the best profs ever!

Seager is an interesting and enthusiastic prof. His lectures tend to be painfully boring and disorganized though. It's weird when the tutorial is the best part of this class, but it was. Class work is managable though. A midterm, paper, and final are all very easy. Overall, a nice guy and a relatively easy class.

This man is very enthusiastic about the subject matter, and has great suggestions for papers if you ask him. Lectures are disorganised, but can be informative. I would recommend  actually paying attention and making an effort: your term paper will thank you for it. I'd take him again.

Important to participate in tutorials as he will take note of who's who through this venue. The tutorials have little direction and are often irrelivant. One needs to make sure they take good notes in the lecture, participate in tutorial, and ask pointed questions to keep this compess-less captain on track and to ensure the relevance of info.

While the topics can be quite boring, this class was very much student lead. We each did a small presentation on the reading material each week. He was nice and a fair marker, I really have nothing to complain about.

Dr. Seager is really nice and is very interested in the subject he teaches. His lectures are okay and his exams were okay as well. Be sure to take good notes because he bases much of his examinable material on them. His only fault is that he isn't very clear is explaining assignments so don't be afraid to ask him! Otherwise, pretty good overall.

The quintessential ol' history prof! He looks like one & def. acts like one: a little scattered, loves the topic, and not extremely forthcoming.  Go to his lectures, take good notes cuz his midterm's on them.  Takes attendance in tutorial but counts as participation marks. Overall, take him but 1st yr students: he doesn't hold your hand as others d

If something is unclear then ask. He doesn't have a clear structure but the topics he covers are interesting. Read the text if you just want to know narrative history. He gives you interesting details not in the text. He tests on his lectures so go, listen, take notes and ask questions. He's approachable - ask if you need help, extensions & clarity

Although, yes Seager is nice, and can recall facts, his ability to convey his thoughts logically is seriously lacking!! I thought I was taking social hist, he taught political/econ. He was politically incorrect and offensive.  And he handed in the grades way past the due date! NEVER take him!!!

Assignments were unclear, and final was even worse. Wondered from topic to topic during lecture without any cohesion. Although his recall memory is impressive, his ability to teach is not. Wouldn't recommend, especially if History isn't your major.
Great prof.  He's one of the professor's you'll remember when your in an office job down the road.  He makes a difficult job look easy.
This teacher rocks.  Way too cool for academia.

Nice guy but very boring!! Watching paint dry is more interesting than the lectures! Don't take this class with him if you want to learn-I learned NOTHING so it was a waste of money in terms of textbooks and tuition!! Fair marker though.

This teacher is great.  He has a very good memory for facts and figures, and enjoys working with students that are interested in the topic.  If you make an effort you'll have a good time and learn something.
Whoa..what a brutal course! Fairly hard marker-i would rate this course a zzzZZZZ...trust me-don't listen to the other reviews, cuz he wasn't easy at all!!
one of the nicest and approachable prof. He is fair and very intelligent; he knows alot. Sometimes the lectures are hard to follow, but overall his teachings and marking was fair.
Really nice guy.  If you're planning on majoring in History I would advise you to take a class with this guy.  Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

i thought he was a good teacher. His lectures were sometimes hard to follow (to sift through what was relevent and what was not) but his personality was great, he's a really fair and helpful teacher, and he got me pretty interested in a class i thought i would hate.
What a horrible prof! Make sure you bring a pillow!

Everything that made Communism fail is exemplified in this petty little weirdo.  I never thought I was right wing, but being a bathed fitness-conscious woman seems to have peeved him.  What Would Jesus do to Red Al?

Good prof, knows his stuff.  Allen isn't exactly clear on what he wants assignment wise, however he is a very fair marker.  I learned quite a bit about Canadian culture and I'd take another class with him.

Intellectually Allan is great, personality wise; he tries. Just keep in mind that this is a theoretical class based on ideas and methodlogy not facts...facts are for 100 levels classes; Allan, and fourth year HIST students, are past this! some contact (by email) would be helpful but overall good!

Great prof. Knows is stuff, one of the better prof at SFU history. Easy going, lectures are a breeze, FAIR marker, learned some new things about Cdn history.  Happy I took the course with him over other profs

Absolutely ridiculous. Nothing could have been gained or learned from this class. No organization, lecutres were all over the place. The worst history class (if it can be called that)I have taken by far. This guy is totally out of it.
boring class and reading materials

There is reality and then there is Seager's head. This guy is so funny and insane at the same time. When I went to his office to ask him very directed questions he would tell me what he had for lunch earlier that day. Out of this world, LITERALLY!
There is something very odd going on in this man's head.
Great Prof, one of the best i've had. Very, friendly, encouraging and approachable. Also a fair marker.
Quite easy, just do the readings and assignments, and you will be laughing.  Nothing stressful, easy going prof - no pressure in seminars.  Very passionate about course knowledge.
Can be all over the place, and have weird topics, but very helpful and friendly/talkative with students
boring and unhelpful
